title: Strange stutter looking effect. HELP
body:
Hi so recently I have been playing lol without Vsync enabled due to the fact that Vsync is causing me issues on the new rift. I get about 150+ FPS at all times (GTX780) but when I hold space bar to lock screen on champion I notice this stutter looking effect on the outside of the screen or on the ground, it's hard to explain it and it's not terrible noticeable but I know this does not occur with when Vsync is enabled and it bothers me. It may have to do with the fact that my monitor is 60Hz and the frames are much higher? If anyone knows what's going on I would love an explination and perhaps a potential fix. 

Thanks

So the Adaptive Vsync seemed to help, but i read that forcing Vsync on, enabling triple buffering, and setting the fps limiter to 58 in Nvidia Inspector could allow you to have 60 fps in-game and have less input lag. But when i force Vsync it does not seem to work, my FPS remains high in-game and only the limiter takes effect causing tearing. I tried forcing Vsync without limiter and it does not enable in-game. Does Vysnc only work in-game in League of Legends?

Hi Dboss9!

From reading your explanation of what you are talking about, it may be related to the "smooth" camera option due to the high FPS that the game is running at.  Make sure that the "smooth camera" option is enabled through the in-game settings.  To be more specific, you can find it here:

Open the In-game Menu --> Click on the "Game" tab at the bottom --> Select "enable smooth camera"

If this doesn't fix the weird stuttering, have you tried capping your FPS at 60?  It may also help.

Let me know if you continue to experience issues!

Hi Dboss9,

I think Riot are aware of some decent rigs lagging - according to this post (which may or may not be old news), they reckon it's an audio bug and mentioned disabling audio ingame as a temporary fix/workaround: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-report/E2OksgbE-gameplay-fps-drop-in-new-summoners-rift?show=flat&comment=0026

Alternatively you can try dialing down the likes of Shadows to see if it helps while they continue to work on a patch/fix for it :-)

I think this one might be out of your control - unless you're forcing like 16x/32x Anti Aliasing on in the Nvidia Control Panel, you shouldn't really be lagging in LoL :-)

Hi Dboss9,

VSync is designed for the exact reason of stopping this sort of thing - basically your monitor is refreshing at 60Hz a second, or 60 times a second. This equates to 60 Frames Per Second. Anything over 60FPS means your screen is getting more frames a second than it can refresh at, thus it causes strange artifacts such as "screen tearing" and desynchronisation.

If you're running at 60Hz, stick on VSync - you'll be capped at 60FPS which will ensure they are in sync (Hence the name vertical sync :-P)

Having higher FPS than refresh rate is entirely useless, it may sound cool to have 150FPS but really it's doing nothing other than causing issues beyond 60FPS :-)

tl;dr: This happens, use VSync.

Thanks so much for the response! Yea I thought it could have to do with this, but my issue with Vsync currently is that on the new rift I am experiencing big fps drops that I believe are tied to champion ablities, and so when Vsync is enabled fps drops are very noticale as it goes from 60 to below 60 (40 or so). Compared to when Vsync is disabled the drop is not noticeable because fps is much higher than monitor refresh rate, or at least that's my theory lol. But Vsync does work on dominion and Aram.
